name: Lotad
disruptions:
Board: Rocks and Barriers in the bottom
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 6 Rocks and 4 Barriers on rows 1-2 every 4 moves
recommendedParty:
[Abomasnow]/[Glalie]/
[Charizard Y]/[Blaziken]/
[Heracross]/[Gengar]

Avalugg, Salamence,
Braviary, Scyther

Delphox, Heatran,
Genesect, Articuno

Reshiram, Lugia,
Talonflame, Kyurem
clearingStrategy:
Bring a Barrier Bash (+) with you, else
you will be badly surprised by the
disruption. Other than that the stage
is pretty easy, you should not have 
any problem clearing this itemless.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 8 moves left

Should be doable itemless, maybe take a
Moves +5 for the less fortunate people

name: Psyduck
disruptions:
Board: 6 Barrier Psyduck and 5 Metal
Initial: Adds 3 Psyduck in column 1
Timer: Adds 3 Psyduck in column 5 after 3 moves. Adds 3 Psyduck in column 1 after 3 moves. Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Ampharos]/[Manectric]/
[Venusaur]/[Sceptile]

Roserade, Gogoat,
Dedenne, Magnezone

Zapdos, Raikou, Virizion,
Luxray, Chesnaught

Zekrom, Thundurus,
Shaymin
clearingStrategy:
Match some Psyduck together to
remove some barriers. Then ideally,
use Zekrom to remove the Metal.
After that you can pile on the damage
and clear itemless.

Bringing a Barrier Bash+ is better than
bringing Eject+ from my testing.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 6 moves left

Catch Psyduck and bring it for the 
itemless S rank using M-Gengar or Ray,
Zekrom, Virizion and Psyduck itself.

Else, M-Ray/Gengar, Zekrom, Zygarde50%
and Virizion can take this with Moves +5,
itemless with loads of luck.

name: Cranidos
disruptions:
Board: 2 squares of 2x2 Metal
Initial: None
Timer: Adds a 2x2 block of Metal blocks every 3 moves
recommendedParty:
[Lucario]/[Mawile]/
[Medicham]/[Blastoise]/
[Swampert]/[Sceptile]/
[Steelix]

Milotic, Klinklang,
Conkeldurr, Pangoro,
Gogoat, Roserade

Gallade, Cobalion,
Virizion, Gliscor

Shaymin, Palkia,
Machamp
clearingStrategy:
Bringing a Block Smash + Pokémon
is really helpful for this stage, but even
Block Smash can help and clear
the level itemless.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Doable itemless when Block Smash+ 
activates nicely. Moves +5 is more than 
enough to S rank this even without a Block
Smash+.

name: Yanma
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 5 Rocks
Timer: Adds 5 Rocks every 2 moves
recommendedParty:
[Charizard Y]/[Blaziken]

Salamence, Braviary,
Ninetales, Tyranitar

Delphox, Moltres,
Heatran, Terrakion

Ho-Oh, Lugia, Gigalith,
Talonflame, Emboar
clearingStrategy:
Easy stage, you will not have any 
trouble itemless if you take care
of the barriers when they are spawned
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Doable itemless with full fire team (having
Reshiram helps a lot, Emboar is a good
replacement)

name: Glameow
disruptions:
Board: 
Initial: Adds 2 Metal blocks and a Barrier
Timer: Adds 2 Metal blocks and a Barrier every 2 moves

Shape: MXM / XBX
recommendedParty:
[Lucario]/[Medicham]/
[Mewtwo X]

Conkeldurr, Mienshao,
Sawk, Pangoro

Gallade

Machamp
clearingStrategy:
As with every 3 pokémon stage, take
M-Gengar with you and power through
this stage with Lucario (for Pummel) 
and your best fighting type. Gallade is 
nice to remove the metal.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 4 moves left

Doable itemless.

name: Lombre
disruptions:
Board: 4 Barrier Metal on row 5 + 2 Metal on row 6
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 6 Metal blocks in rows 1-2 after 3 moves. Adds 6 Barriers in rows 1-2 after 3 moves. Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Abomasnow]/[Glalie]/
[Charizard Y]/[Blaziken]/
[Heracross]/[Gengar]

Avalugg, Salamence,
Braviary, Scyther

Delphox, Heatran,
Genesect, Articuno

Reshiram, Lugia,
Talonflame, Kyurem
clearingStrategy:
Reshiram and Talonflame are very
useful for this stage. Emboar can be
used if you don't have Reshiram.

These 2 with M-Char Y and Delphox
do a good job at beating this stagee
itemless (Candied M-Ray can of 
course be used too)

If you struggle, Moves +5 should be
enough. Take Disruption Delay instead
if you don't have Talonflame with you.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Moves +5 can be enough for this. The S
rank will be almost guaranteed if you go
Moves +5 and Disruption Delay.

name: Golduck
disruptions:
Board: 6 Barriers in cross shape
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 8 Metal blocks after 2 moves. Adds 6 Barriers after 2 moves (in the pattern of initial board). Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Ampharos]/[Manectric]/
[Venusaur]/[Sceptile]

Roserade, Gogoat,
Dedenne, Magnezone

Zapdos, Raikou, Virizion,
Luxray, Chesnaught

Zekrom, Thundurus,
Shaymin
clearingStrategy:
Zekrom is a huge asset on this stage.
Take the first turns to remove as many
of the initial barriers as possible.
Then activate Zekrom to remove some
metal to give yourself some space
to combo. M-Amphy or Manectric are
nice to help remove the disruptions.

You can always try to take Shaymin
and activate Sleep Charm, will help
but is of course luck reliant.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Possible itemless if you activate Sleep
Charm and get lucky with combos. But
Moves +5 here again is enough to get the
S rank, even though it also relies on Block
Smash+ / Sleep Charm activating enough.
Disruption Delay alone is another option.

Taking both items is a bit overkill, but
if you roll in coins then why not.

name: Trapinch
disruptions:
Board: Pre determined
Initial: None
Timer: None
recommendedParty: Any
clearingStrategy:
Follow these moves:
D2->D6, C1->C6, C6->B3, E5-<C4,
A2->C5

It may look bad at some point, but 
trust me, I'm an engineer (or at least
the one who found this solution is)
srankingStrategy: Moves: At least 0 moves left

name: Binacle
disruptions:
Board: 4 Metal in the middle of row 6
Initial: Adds 6 Rocks on rows 1-2
Timer: Adds 6 Rocks on rows 1-2 after 2 moves x4 (counting initial). Adds 4 Metal blocks right after the 4th disruption (in row 6). Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Lucario]/[Mawile]/
[Medicham]/[Blastoise]/
[Swampert]/[Sceptile]

Milotic, Steelix, Klinklang,
Conkeldurr, Pangoro,
Gogoat, Roserade

Gallade, Cobalion,
Virizion, Gliscor

Shaymin, Palkia,
Machamp
clearingStrategy:
Dialga and Gliscor bring here 2 abilities
that are useful. Other than that, the 
stage is not super hard to beat.
Very doable itemless, Moves +5 if
your pokémon are not super high level.

Just match near the disrupted Rocks
and you will never be overwhelmed.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Doable itemless with a bit of combos, else
Moves +5 with a good team should be 
enough to secure this.

name: Rampardos
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Fills a column and a row with Metal
Timer: Fills a column and a row with Metal every 4 moves
recommendedParty:
[Lucario]/[Mawile]/
[Medicham]/[Blastoise]/
[Swampert]/[Sceptile]/
[Steelix]

Milotic, Klinklang,
Conkeldurr, Pangoro,
Gogoat, Roserade

Gallade, Cobalion,
Virizion, Gliscor

Shaymin, Palkia,
Machamp
clearingStrategy:
Steelix is the best Mega you can
use for this stage here. Bring Dialga
and Gallade to clear the Metal before
Steelix has evolved, and then let
M-Steelix do the job.
You can bring either Jirachi to evolve
Steelix faster, or Virizion for Power
of 4+ when the Metal is cleared. Both
are different strategies. Virizion is
probably better as you want to activate
Gallade/Dialga early to clear the Metal.

If you do not have Steelix, or if you're
missing some Block Smash+ 
pokémon go M-Aero with Mega Start. 
It's the  only easy way I can think 
of without the key pokémon.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Moves +5 is enough if you have Steelix/
Dialga/Gallade. Mega Start with Steelix if
you see itemless that Moves +5 won't be
enough.

Else you can go Disruption Delay and full
damage team with Po4+ (Virizion, Ash-
Greninja) with M-Gengar or M-Ray
to beat this stage pretty easily. Throw in
a Moves +5 for safety.

Mega Start Aerodactyl and Moves +5
is the other alternative (don't bring any
Block Smash with this, just pure damage
to compensate the fact that Aero is NVE)

If you get Mega Start (with either Aero or
Steelix), bring Power of 4+ pokémon for
maximum damage output.

name: Slugma
disruptions:
Board: 6 Rocks and 14 black clouds
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 6 Rocks after 4 moves x8. Adds 3 or 6 black clouds after the last disruption. Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Blastoise]/[Swampert]/
[Garchomp]

Excadrill, Milotic,
Stunfisk, Seismitoad,
Tyranitar

Terrakion, Greninja,
Gliscor, Suicune

Palkia, Groudon,
Kyogre, Gigalith,
Ash-Greninja
clearingStrategy:
Gliscor is nice to bring here too.
The visibility is limited but the stage
is not heavy in disruptions nor in HP,
easily doable itemless.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Possible itemless with good combos,
Moves +5 will almost guarantee it.
You can check if Moves +5 will be enough 
if you always have at least 2 moves left 
when clearing itemless.

I know M-Gengar works fine for S ranking
this itemless.

name: Purugly
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 3 Metal blocks
Timer: Adds 3 Metal blocks after every move
recommendedParty:
[Lucario]/[Medicham]/
[Mewtwo X]

Conkeldurr, Mienshao,
Sawk, Pangoro

Gallade

Machamp
clearingStrategy:
Stage is doable with either M-Gengar 
or M-Rayquaza. Gallade is super 
useful to remove the metal blocks,
especially since on a 3 pokémon
stage it's almost always possible to
align 4 to make sure to proc the
ability.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 4 moves left

Luck reliant to finish itemless, but doable.
Moves +5 for securing it.

name: Natu
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 1 Metal block and 5 Barriers in rows 1-2 or 5-6
Timer: Adds 1 Metal block and 5 Barriers in rows 1-2 or 5-6 every 3 moves
recommendedParty:
[Gengar]/[Sharpedo]/
[Absol]/[Heracross]/
[Banette]

Scyther, Scizor,
Volcarona, Zoroark

Genesect, Yveltal,
Bisharp, Malamar,
Genesect

Giratina, Pinsir,
Darkrai, Dialga
clearingStrategy:
Very easy stage. Go M-Gengar with
optimise (preferably among Genesect,
Heracross, Giratina, Darkrai) and
you will beat this stage without any
 trouble
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Easily doable itemless

name: Skrelp
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 1 Metal and 1 Rock x2
Timer: Adds 1 Metal and 1 Rock x2 every 2 moves
recommendedParty:
[Mewtwo Y]/[Slowbro]/
[Garchomp]

Excadrill, Stunfisk,
Deoxys, Marowak,
Golurk

Gliscor

Cresselia, Victini,
Groudon, Dialga
clearingStrategy:
Golurk is the only Super Effective
with Block Smash+, so if you were
fortunate enough to have caught it,
it can shine here.
Bring M-Gengar with you and the
stage will do itself.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 4 moves left

Doable itemless with M-Gengar and Golurk

Without Golurk, try with another Block
Smash + Pokémon, you should still get
enough combos not to need a Moves +5

name: Magcargo
disruptions:
Board: 12 black clouds
Initial: Adds 3 Metal blocks in row 1
Timer: Adds 3 Metal in row 1 every 2 moves
recommendedParty:
[Blastoise]/[Swampert]/
[Garchomp]

Excadrill, Milotic,
Stunfisk, Seismitoad,
Tyranitar, Golurk

Terrakion, Greninja,
Gliscor, Suicune

Palkia, Groudon,
Kyogre, Gigalith,
Ash-Greninja
clearingStrategy:
Again, Golurk (or Gigalith)  is a really 
great pick for this stage. It's a bit 
harder, but try to match 4 Golurk after 
every disruption to remove the Metal.
Then, M-Garchomp can take care
of them, with the black clouds.

Of course Candied M-Ray does a good
job here (as on every other stage, in
case you did not know).
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Moves +5 with M-Garchomp is doable,
just like with M-Ray candied.
Strategy is the same, use Golurk to 
remove metal. If you don't have it, you
may lack damage by using another Block
Smash+, so maybe you will need to shift
your strategy towards Moves +5 and
Mega Start (with M-Garchomp or another
block clearing Super Effective Mega)

name: Barbaracle
disruptions:
Board: 8 Metal blocks
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 3 Metal + 2 Metal blocks every 3 moves
recommendedParty:
[Lucario]/[Mawile]/
[Medicham]/[Blastoise]/
[Swampert]/[Sceptile]/
[Steelix]

Milotic, Golurk, Klinklang,
Conkeldurr, Pangoro,
Gogoat, Roserade

Gallade, Cobalion,
Virizion, Gliscor

Shaymin, Palkia,
Machamp
clearingStrategy:
Bring the Block Smash + crew, or
at least 2 of them with M-Garchomp.
Maybe M-Steelix is nice, I have not
tried it out.
But Gallade & Dialga are really good
here. Bring Golurk if you miss one of
these 2. The stage will be hard to beat
itemless, but it's doable.

It's probably better to use Disruption
Delay instead of Moves +5 to beat
this stage, so that you get a higher
catch rate afterwards (this one has
Crowd Control, so pretty good)
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Moves +5 does not really guarantee the S
rank as you could get screwed by Block
Smash+ not activating on matches of 3.
I'm not saying it's possible, just not reliable.

Disruption Delay with Moves +5 will work
very well to guarantee the S rank and give
a high catch rate.

name: Combee
disruptions:
Board: A lot of Combee and Rocks in the bottom left half
Initial: Adds 4 Combee and 1 Vespiquen
Timer: Adds 4 Combee and 1 Vespiquen every 4 moves
recommendedParty:
[Charizard Y]/[Blaziken]

Salamence, Braviary,
Ninetales, Tyranitar,
Fearow

Delphox, Moltres,
Heatran, Terrakion

Ho-Oh, Lugia, Gigalith,
Talonflame, Emboar
clearingStrategy:
Board looks bad, but it's not that hard.
The disruption happens in top right,
you can remove the 4 Combee easily
and put the Vespiquen in the far 
bottom left. This will give you space
to then trigger your ejects and combo.

Full Fire team, or M Ray and Eject 
both work fine.

Fearow with Rock Break+ is really nice
here, can make the Combee match
themselves. Can put it instead of 
Tyranitar, but keep Lugia for Eject+.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 6 moves left

If you can clear itemless, Moves +5 will 
probably be enough. Catching and bringing
Combee may be an alternative to S rank
itemless.

name: Deino
disruptions:
Board: 2 Barriers and 6 black clouds
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 2 Barriers and 1 black cloud every 4 moves
recommendedParty:
[Heracross]/[Lucario]/
[Medicham]/[Gardevoir]

Conkeldurr, Scyther,
Pangoro,

Gallade, Genesect,
Xerneas

Diancie, Machamp
clearingStrategy:
Easy stage, doable itemless.
The barriers are not a problem, and 
with a cloud clearing Mega you will
have no trouble finishing.

Diancie shines here with Barrier 
Bash+. If you don't have it, don't
bother bringing a non SE pokémon,
you can still deal with the barriers.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Having Diancie makes this stage possible
to S rank itemless, otherwise you may
need to buy Moves +5 to ensure it.

name: Xatu
disruptions:
Board: 6 Xatu on board
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 3 Metal and 3 Xatu on row 1 after 2 moves. Adds 6 Metal and 2 Xatu on rows 1-2 after 2 moves. Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Gengar]/[Sharpedo]/
[Absol]/[Heracross]/
[Banette]

Scyther, Scizor,
Volcarona, Zoroark

Genesect, Yveltal,
Bisharp, Malamar,
Genesect

Giratina, Pinsir,
Darkrai, Dialga
clearingStrategy:
First move should be F1->E6. Will
clear a LOT of stuff, and deal 1/4 of
its HP. I then proceeded to end with
one other move only o_O

Team was Gengar Genesect Giratina
and Darkrai. If you're not as lucky as
me, try to activate Sleep Charm to
finish the stage easily. Buying a 
Disruption Delay will murder this
stage if it causes you trouble.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 6 moves left

Doable itemless with some luck, else
you should get this with DD alone (maybe
Moves +5 for safety? I feel DD is more
than enough)

name: Dragalge
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 3 Metal blocks x2
Timer: Adds 3 Metal blocks x2 every 2 moves
recommendedParty:
[Mewtwo Y]/[Slowbro]/
[Garchomp]

Excadrill, Stunfisk,
Deoxys, Marowak,
Golurk

Gliscor

Cresselia, Victini,
Groudon, Dialga
clearingStrategy:
Disruptions are pretty brutal. I find
it quite hard with M-Garchomp and
Golurk to keep up with them, but it
is possible.

Just buy a Disruption Delay, go
Mega Mewtwo Y psychic team and
you will destroy this level.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 11 moves left

Disruption Delay with Psychic team is
the best way to S rank this stage for not
much money.

name: Vespiquen
disruptions:
Board: 6 Rocks, 10 Combee and 2 Vespiquen
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 4 Combee and 2 Vespiquen after 3 moves. Adds 4 Combee and 2 Barriers after 3 moves. Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Charizard Y]/[Blaziken]

Salamence, Braviary,
Ninetales, Tyranitar,
Combee

Delphox, Moltres,
Heatran, Terrakion

Ho-Oh, Lugia, Gigalith,
Talonflame, Emboar
clearingStrategy:
First move C5->B6 clears some stuff
if no ability is triggered (all 6 Combee
from the lower part will match, 
removing some rocks at the same time

Take Gengar with you again, with the
Eject crew (Lugia and Tyranitar).
You should not have any trouble even
with the Combee on the board. Make
them fall at the bottom and they'll
match each other.

Bringing Combee if you have it is also
an option, and will make this stage 
even easier. And Lugia to eject the
Vespiquen.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 4 moves left

Doable itemless with Gengar + Lugia + Any
but Gengar Lugia Combee is the best
option to S rank it.

name: Zweilous
disruptions:
Board: 7 black clouds and 2 Zweilous
Initial: Adds 3 black clouds
Timer: Adds 3 Metal and 3 Zweilous on row 1 after 2 moves. Adds 3 black clouds after 2 moves. Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Heracross]/[Lucario]/
[Medicham]/[Gardevoir]

Conkeldurr, Scyther,
Pangoro,

Gallade, Genesect,
Xerneas

Diancie, Machamp
clearingStrategy:
Take Gallade with you if you have it.
Rayquaza does a good job for
Mega here, I used it. Not much
to say about this level, it's not super
hard with a Block Smash (+).

Don't pay attention to the Zweilous,
just match them if they start to 
accumulate but you should be able to
combo and let them fall at the bottom.

Can bring Machamp for the Eject too.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Moves +5 is enough to get the S rank.

name:
Unown
(! Forme)
disruptions:
Board: 
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 6 Metal and 4 Unown in columns 1-2 every 6 moves
recommendedParty:
[Gengar]/[Sharpedo]/
[Absol]/[Heracross]/
[Banette]

Scyther, Scizor,
Volcarona, Zoroark

Genesect, Yveltal,
Bisharp, Malamar,
Genesect

Giratina, Pinsir,
Darkrai, Dialga
clearingStrategy:
Do B4->E4 to clear all Unown.
Then try to finish the stage before the
first disruption hits, because it's pretty
bad. Giratina deals monster damage
here. Gengar as Mega is fine and
Genesect deals damage too. Darkrai
can sleep charm, if he does then it's
in the bag easily.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 6 moves left

Doable itemless. Moves +5 will get you this
No need for a Disruption Delay.

name: Horsea
disruptions:
Board: 6 Barriers
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 3 Barriers in row 3 after 2 moves.Adds 3 Barriers in row 4 after 2 moves. Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Ampharos]/[Manectric]/
[Venusaur]/[Sceptile]

Roserade, Gogoat,
Dedenne, Magnezone

Zapdos, Raikou, Virizion,
Luxray, Chesnaught

Zekrom, Thundurus,
Shaymin
clearingStrategy:
The disruptions are not that bad, with
a leveled up team you will be able to
beat thhis itemless.

You can just bring your best Super
Effective team, no need to sub in
a Barrier Bash+.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Possibly doable itemless, but requires
a lot of combos. Moves +5 is the cheapest
and most reasonable way to ensure the
S rank here.

name: Shieldon
disruptions:
Board: 10 Metal blocks in rows 4-5
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 3 Metal on row 1 every 3  moves
recommendedParty:
[Lucario]/[Mawile]/
[Medicham]/[Blastoise]/
[Swampert]/[Sceptile]

Milotic, Steelix, Klinklang,
Conkeldurr, Pangoro,
Gogoat, Roserade

Gallade, Cobalion,
Virizion, Gliscor

Shaymin, Palkia,
Machamp
clearingStrategy:
Pretty straightforward stage, bring at
least one Block Smash+ and you
will beat this itemless without trouble.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

A Moves +5 might be needed because it
requires quite the combos to get this done
itemless.

name: Scraggy
disruptions:
Board: Pre determined
Initial: None
Timer: After a combo of 2+, adds 10 Metal blocks in the following pattern

Pattern: MMMM / MXXM / MMMM
recommendedParty:
[Heracross]/[Lucario]/
[Medicham]/[Gardevoir]

Conkeldurr, Scyther,
Pangoro,

Gallade, Genesect,
Xerneas

Diancie, Machamp
clearingStrategy:
Change of keikaku, a brave redditor by
the name of Optitron2005 has come up
with a far better solution.

Do the following moves: B6 → B5, 
E6 → E5,  E5 → C3, E6 → D3, 
D6 → D5.
Board will super clear and tons of
Scraggy will fall and finish the level.


* keikaku means plan
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 0 moves left

Well this is free.

name: Rhyhorn
disruptions:
Board: 5 Metal and 5 Rocks
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 4 Metal and 1 Rock or 4 Rocks and 1 Metal every 3 moves (left or right part of the initial board setup)
recommendedParty:
[Abomasnow]/[Glalie]/
[Venusaur]/[Blastoise]/
[Swampert]/[Sceptile]

Avalugg, Milotic, Gogoat,
Roserade

Virizion, Mamoswine,
Chesnaught

Shaymin, Kyurem,
Kyogre, Staross
clearingStrategy:
Stage is not hard, there is no real
need to bring a Block Smash + poké
here, especially since there are no SE
ones. 

M-Sceptile and M-Rayquaza both 
work well, but Sceptile does not need
candies ;)
M-Glalie or Blastoise are also nice
especially because they can remove 
some of the disruptions, that should
work too. Overall an easy stage,
a lot of things work out here.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Doable itemless with some combos, but
as always, Moves +5 really helps if needed.

name: Patrat
disruptions:
Board: 4 Rocks and a 2x2 group of Metal
(huehue)
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 6 Rocks in columns 1-2 every 2 moves
recommendedParty:
[Lucario]/[Medicham]/
[Mewtwo X]

Conkeldurr, Mienshao,
Sawk, Pangoro

Gallade

Machamp
clearingStrategy:
Easily doable itemless with Gengar,
Lucario and Gallade. Activate Gallade
once to remove some metal and then
activate Lucario for the damage bonus
on fighting attacks.
Even without Gallade the metal stay
manageable, it will just be harder to
S rank without items.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 4 moves left

Itemless with Gallade. May require a 
Moves +5 otherwise.

name: Seadra
disruptions:
Board: 3 Barriers on row 3 and on row 4
Initial: Adds 6 black clouds in rows 3-4
Timer: Adds 6 Barriers in rows 3-4 after 2 moves. Adds 6 black clouds in rows 3-4 after 2 moves. Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Ampharos]/[Manectric]/
[Venusaur]/[Sceptile]

Roserade, Gogoat,
Dedenne, Magnezone

Zapdos, Raikou, Virizion,
Luxray, Chesnaught

Zekrom, Thundurus,
Shaymin
clearingStrategy:
Barriers and clouds complement
themselves on rows 3-4, so it makes
it harder and longer to find good 
combos.

There is no SE Barrier Bash+ poké,
however I think that bringing one is a
good move. Activating Sleep Charm
with Shaymin is also good, so 
whatever works for you.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

If you can beat the stage itemless, it's very
probable that a Moves +5 will be enough
for this one.

If it's harder, then go Disruption Delay with
the Moves +5, it should warrant the S rank.

name: Bastiodon
disruptions:
Board: 6 Barriers and 6 Metal in rows 3-4
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 6 Barriers and 6 Metal on rows 3-4 every 3 moves

HP<=56%: Adds 6 Metal and 6 Barriers in columns 3-4 every 4 moves
recommendedParty:
[Lucario]/[Mawile]/
[Medicham]/[Blastoise]/
[Swampert]/[Sceptile]

Milotic, Steelix, Klinklang,
Conkeldurr, Pangoro,
Gogoat, Roserade

Gallade, Cobalion,
Virizion, Gliscor

Shaymin, Palkia,
Machamp, Dialga, Landorus, Landorus-T
clearingStrategy:
First very hard stage in this zone.
You will need a Disruption Delay to
beat it, because Palkia and Dialga
can't keep up with the disruption rate.

However with the additions of new Pokemons & ability, you may not need DD. Go for Jirachi+ M-Steelix, plus Barrier Bash+ and you can eventually beat it itemless. Lando-T is a good support for its damage too.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 11 moves left

Barely got the S rank with 11 moves left
using M-Ray, Landorus-T, Dialga and
Palkia (all Max level, Rayquaza full candy).
Only Disruption Delay was used.

It is safe to assume that DD and Moves +5
are good with that team, but you may
need to switch Mega if your Rayquaza is 
not candied (or do Disruption Delay + Mega
Start; Moves +5 would be overkill with this)

name: Rhydon
disruptions:
Board: 6 Rocks and 6 Metal
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 3 Rocks and 3 Metal to row 3 and adds 4 Rocks + 4 Metal to columns 3-4 every 5 moves
recommendedParty:
[Abomasnow]/[Glalie]/
[Venusaur]/[Blastoise]/
[Swampert]/[Sceptile]

Avalugg, Milotic, Gogoat,
Roserade

Virizion, Mamoswine,
Chesnaught, Walrein

Shaymin, Kyurem,
Kyogre, Staross
clearingStrategy:
M-Glalie shines here because it 
removes the disruption pattern quite
well. It's wise to bring a Block Smash+
as you have nothing SE to deal with 
metal before Glalie evolves.

Walrein/Kyogre can help to remove
rocks faster.

Even with a team of SE only, this 
stage is beatable itemless.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 8 moves left

Moves +5 can be enough to S rank this.
If you see from your itemless tries that you
never have at least 3 moves left, I suggest
you either get a Mega Start with M-Glalie,
or take a Disruption Delay with the Mega of
your choice (both options with Moves +5)

name: Scrafty
disruptions:
Board: Tons of Scrafty, and 6 Barriers
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 3 Scrafty and 2 Barriers and 2 Metal every 2 moves
recommendedParty:
[Heracross]/[Lucario]/
[Medicham]/[Gardevoir]

Conkeldurr, Scyther,
Pangoro,

Gallade, Genesect,
Xerneas

Diancie, Machamp
clearingStrategy:
Beating this stage is possible without
items. Focus on removing the Scrafty
under barriers in the top, and do not
mind the ones in the bottom.
Gengar Diancie Machamp can take
this
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 4 moves left

If you have caught Scrafty, then it's an 
easier itemless S rank. Bringing Rayquaza
instead of Gengar may be wiser else you
will have 2 NVE types and it won't be 
that easy to beat without huge combos.

Without it, you may take a Moves +5 with
you to ensure it.

name:
Unown
(? Forme)
disruptions:
Board: Pre determined
Initial: None
Timer: None
recommendedParty:
[Gengar]/[Sharpedo]/
[Absol]/[Heracross]/
[Banette]

Scyther, Scizor,
Volcarona, Zoroark

Genesect, Yveltal,
Bisharp, Malamar,
Genesect

Giratina, Pinsir,
Darkrai, Dialga
clearingStrategy:
The whispers of the people have told
me that B5->B4, B2->B4, D3->B4, 
E5->E6, B5->E4 will break the blocks
in the stage. After that, is should not
be that hard to beat the stage.

A3>E6, D4>C3, D4>B5, B5>E5, 
D4>B3 should work too
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 5 moves left

Tricky to finish with 5 moves itemless 
considering the puzzle part of the stage,
so getting a Moves +5 is a nice option here.

name: Watchog
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 3 Barriers and 3 Watchog in a column
Timer: Adds 3 Barriers and 3 Watchog in a column every 2 moves
recommendedParty:
[Lucario]/[Medicham]/
[Mewtwo X]

Conkeldurr, Mienshao,
Sawk, Pangoro

Gallade

Machamp
clearingStrategy:
I brought Palkia in this stage with
M-Lucario and Gallade+Machamp, and
managed to clear itemless. Bringing
a Barrier Bash+ is really important here

Activate Barrier Bash+ and you can 
clear the 3 spawned Watchog. When
you have M-Lucario try to remove the
disrupted columns when you can.

If you really struggle, Disruption Delay
will help tremendously.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Bringing Watchog instead of the Barrier  
Bash+ probably makes S ranking itemless 
possible.

However if you want the S rank before
catching it, then you probably need Moves
+5 and a Disruption Delay to be sure.

name:
Shellos
(Westeros Sea)
disruptions:
Board: 2 triangles of 6 Barriers
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 6 Barriers every 3 moves (one triangle randomly)
recommendedParty:
[Ampharos]/[Manectric]/
[Venusaur]/[Sceptile]

Roserade, Gogoat,
Dedenne, Magnezone

Zapdos, Raikou, Virizion,
Luxray, Chesnaught

Zekrom, Thundurus,
Shaymin
clearingStrategy:
Stage is doable without a Barrier 
Bash+, but when you bring one you 
can combo faster, which compensates
the loss of damage of not bringing a
SE pokémon.

Focus on removing barriers of course,
try to pierce through and then you'll
have space to dish out the damage.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Possible itemless with a full candied M-Ray
and a Barrier Basher+, if you lack some of
these things then a Moves +5 will be the
help you need.

name: Vibrava
disruptions:
Board: Barriers on row 6
Initial: Adds 2 Vibrava and 6 Rocks to rows 5-6 and fills row 5 with Barriers
Timer: Adds 2 Vibrava and 6 Rocks to rows 5-6 and fills row 5 with Barriers every 2 moves
recommendedParty:
[Abomasnow]/[Glalie]/
[Venusaur]/[Blastoise]/
[Swampert]/[Sceptile]

Avalugg, Milotic, Gogoat,
Roserade

Virizion, Mamoswine,
Chesnaught, Walrein

Shaymin, Kyurem,
Kyogre, Palkia
clearingStrategy:
You can go Gengar Palkia Walrein,
with that you are ready to destroy what
you need turn by turn. The Vibrava
are a bit annoying, but after a few
disruptions it's possible to match them
near the rocks so it'll even allow  
combos afterwards.

Doable itemless
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 4 moves left

Possible itemless, Moves +5 for safety
net if you don't want to spend too many
hearts trying.

name: Elekid
disruptions:
Board: Rocks in sort of Elekid's head shape
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 6 Rocks in columns 5-6 or 1-2 every 3 moves
recommendedParty:
[Garchomp]/[Gengar]

Krookodile, Stunfisk,
Marowak, Excadrill

Gliscor

Groudon, Landorus T & L,
Camerupt
clearingStrategy:
Pretty simple stage. Gliscor is useful
for the Rock Break+.
Doable itemless, just look for the
best matches and you'll beat that.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Moves +5 is really helpful, because it it
very luck reliant to get it itemless.

name: Bunnelby
disruptions:
Board: 10 Rocks in the middle
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 2 Bunnelby after 1 move. Adds 2 Rocks after 1 move. Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Lucario]/[Medicham]/
[Mewtwo X]

Conkeldurr, Mienshao,
Sawk, Pangoro

Gallade

Machamp
clearingStrategy:
Not a hard stage. Bring Machamp to
remove some Bunnelby, and match
near the rocks in the beginning to
clear thee stage.

M-Rayquaza works very well, and
Medicham/Lucario too.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 6 moves left

Doable itemless. M-Lucario with Medicham
to evolve faster is good here as you do
not have many moves to S rank.
If you're short on moves, add Moves +5.

name: Gastrodon
disruptions:
Board: 8 Barriers in the bottom
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 7 Barriers after 3 moves (in A4 A3 A2 A1 B1 C1 C2). Adds 8 Barriers after 1 move (like initial board setup). Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Ampharos]/[Manectric]/
[Venusaur]/[Sceptile]

Roserade, Gogoat,
Dedenne, Magnezone

Zapdos, Raikou, Virizion,
Luxray, Chesnaught

Zekrom, Thundurus,
Shaymin
clearingStrategy:
Oh boy look at all these barriers and
compare that to all the Barrier Bash+
pokémon SE against water. u_u

You should bring a Barrier Bash+ Poké
with you. I think Gengar as Mega can
do well here (or M-Ray). M-Gengar
and a Barrier Bash+ do a good job 
against Barriers. Then add Virizion
to deal damage in between disruptions.

Doable itemless, but for some of you
a Disruption Delay with M-Gengar may
be the best solution.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Optimal clearing strategy with only
Moves +5 will do (and a bit of luck, as
always).

If not, go M-Gengar + damage dealers, 
buying Disruption Delay and Moves +5,
and you will get it.

name: Flygon
disruptions:
Board: 6 Rocks + 6 Metal in down arrow shape
Initial: None
Timer: Adds a 2x4 Rocks after 2 moves (top left corner of the 2x4 in C1). Adds 6 Metal in rows 2-3 after 2 moves. Repeat
recommendedParty:
[Abomasnow]/[Glalie]/
[Venusaur]/[Blastoise]/
[Swampert]/[Sceptile]

Avalugg, Milotic, Gogoat,
Roserade

Virizion, Mamoswine,
Chesnaught

Shaymin, Kyurem,
Kyogre, Staross
clearingStrategy:
Another hard stage. It is very tough
to take on without a Disruption Delay,
especially because there is no Block
Smash+ Super Effective. If you go 
Disruption Delay you probably don't 
have to bring one, but focus on 
damage instead (there is Roserade 
with Stabilise+, but the % activation
is low)

I feel M-Abomasnow can do a nice job
if you keep some in the bottom centre,
to annihilate the Rock disruption.

Ultimately, I think buying Disruption
Delay with any Mega (SE or Ray / 
Gengar) and one Rock Break+ or
Block Smash+ is good balance 
between damage and initial board
control.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Disruption Delay and Moves +5 may be 
enough, but I fear it's not 100%
Still not sure whether it's worth to bring
a Block Smash+ or just damage when you
have the DD.

name: Electabuzz
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 4 Rocks and 4 Metal
Timer: Adds 4 Rocks and 4 Metal every 3 moves
recommendedParty:
[Garchomp]/[Gengar]

Krookodile, Stunfisk,
Marowak, Excadrill,
Golurk

Gliscor

Groudon, Landorus T & L
clearingStrategy:
Disruptions are a bit annoying, try
to activate Golurk to remove the Metal
as soon as it appears.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Moves +5 needed for this one.

name: Clamperl
disruptions:
Board: Pre set except for B4 and E4 (2 of
your pokémon)
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 4 Clamperl and 2 Barriers after 1 move (on rows 1-2). Adds 4 Clamperl and 2 Barriers every 6 moves
recommendedParty:
[Ampharos]/[Manectric]/
[Venusaur]/[Sceptile]

Roserade, Gogoat,
Dedenne, Magnezone

Zapdos, Raikou, Virizion,
Luxray, Chesnaught

Zekrom, Thundurus,
Shaymin
clearingStrategy:
Stage is beatable itemless, but still
very annoying. There must be an 
optimal first move, I'll experiment.
Did F4->B4 to clean the right side
A4->E4 will clean the right side.

Other than that you want to remove the
Clamperl when they are spawned to
make space for your combos to 
happen.

Team wise, not much to say, bring
your strongest poké, Ray/Gengar
seem better because they can evolve
fast (candied Ray of course)
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 6 moves left

Definitely doable itemless, but you
can easily be troubled with the first 
disruption, so Moves +5 is a good safety 
net here. M-Gengar seems like a nice
option.

name: Diggersby
disruptions:
Board: 12 Rocks, 2 Metal and 2 Diggersby!
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 8 Rocks and 4 Barriers on 
          rows 3-4 every 4 moves
Pattern: RBRRBR / RBRRBR
recommendedParty:
[Abomasnow]/[Glalie]/
[Venusaur]/[Blastoise]/
[Swampert]/[Sceptile]

Avalugg, Milotic, Gogoat,
Roserade

Virizion, Mamoswine,
Chesnaught, Walrein

Shaymin, Kyurem,
Kyogre, Palkia
clearingStrategy:
Initial stage is horrible, disruptions are
horrible too. Remove or move down
the Diggersby else they will get 
barriered during the 1st disruption,
and that is problematic.

Bring Walrein, there will be a lot of
rocks. Maybe Kyogre on top of that
too. Doable itemless, but a Disruption
Delay will make your life so easy.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

A Disruption Delay is probably needed here.
Add Moves +5 for safety measures. The
Mega is the wildcard, you can take Gengar
or Rayquaza while using the DD.

name: Cacnea
disruptions:
Board: 4 Barrier Cacnea + 2 Cacnea
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 6 Barrier Cacnea every  3 moves
recommendedParty:
[Abomasnow]/[Glalie]/
[Charizard Y]/[Blaziken]/
[Heracross]/[Gengar]

Avalugg, Salamence,
Braviary, Scyther

Delphox, Heatran,
Genesect, Articuno

Reshiram, Lugia,
Talonflame, Kyurem
clearingStrategy:
Let's go Gengar once again.
Reshiram is good for the Barrier Bash+
and Lugia for the Eject+.
Not much more to say. You want to
find a way to activate Lugia on turn 1
to be able to end this quickly.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 4 moves left

Doable itemless if you manage to activate
Lugia's Eject+ each time in the first 2 turns
(a 4-match will always activate it)

name: Huntail
disruptions:
Board: 4 Metal and 8 Barriers
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 2 Metal and 4 Barriers every 4 moves
recommendedParty:
[Ampharos]/[Manectric]/
[Venusaur]/[Sceptile]

Roserade, Gogoat,
Dedenne, Magnezone

Zapdos, Raikou, Virizion,
Luxray, Chesnaught

Zekrom, Thundurus,
Shaymin
clearingStrategy:
Zekrom is immensely helpful on this
stage. If Shaymin procs its Sleep
Charm, then it's super useful too.
Focus on either matching Zekrom
to remove metal fast, or on removing
the barriers (both at the same time if
possible).

However, without Zekrom, this 
becomes a completely different story.
I'd advise to get a Block Smash+ from
another type. You may need to get
a Moves +5 to finish in this case.

The choice of the Mega is Ray/Gengar
as the others are quite slow to evolve,
even if Venusaur/Ampharos/
Manectric can destroy metal and the
barriers.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

Moves +5 for safety measure

Without Zekrom, going DD and Moves +5
with a full SE team (no Block Smash+)
should prove to be efficient.

name: Magby
disruptions:
Board: Some Rocks, Magby and Metal
Initial: None
Timer: Adds 2 Magby and 4 Rocks after 3 moves. Adds 2 Magby and 6 Rocks after 3 moves
recommendedParty:
[Blastoise]/[Swampert]/
[Garchomp]

Excadrill, Milotic,
Stunfisk, Seismitoad,
Tyranitar

Terrakion, Greninja,
Gliscor, Suicune

Palkia, Groudon,
Kyogre, Gigalith,
Ash-Greninja
clearingStrategy:
Bringing Tyranitar is nice to remove
the Magby. Rocks will be removes
as you match so no worries there.
Gliscor can help if you're overwhelmed.

Not that hard of a stage overall, focus
on removing disruptions fast and you'll
be fine.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 6 moves left

Moves +5 is very helpful to S rank this.

name: Cacturne
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 3 Metal and 3 Cacturne to row 5
Timer: Adds 3 Metal and 3 Cacturne to row 5 every 2 moves
recommendedParty:
[Abomasnow]/[Glalie]/
[Charizard Y]/[Blaziken]/
[Heracross]/[Gengar]

Avalugg, Salamence,
Braviary, Scyther

Delphox, Heatran,
Genesect, Articuno

Reshiram, Lugia,
Talonflame, Kyurem
clearingStrategy:
Lugia and Talonflame is a good combo
to remove the 2 kinds of disruptions,
but they are quite frequent so it'll
be hard to keep up.

Stage is a bit hard to clear itemless
consistently, but definitely doable.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

Disruption Delay alone gets the job done.

name: Gorebyss
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 6 Metal to rows 2-3
Timer: Adds 6 Barriers to rows 4-5 after 2 moves. Adds 6 Metal to rows 2-3 after 2 moves
recommendedParty:
[Ampharos]/[Manectric]/
[Venusaur]/[Sceptile]

Roserade, Gogoat,
Dedenne, Magnezone

Zapdos, Raikou, Virizion,
Luxray, Chesnaught

Zekrom, Thundurus,
Shaymin
clearingStrategy:
Again, Zekrom does a good job, and
we cry about the lack of Barrier Bash+
against water type.

The metal are annoying, and the 
barriers can be too, locking the bottom
half of the board. If metal are barriered
focus on matching Zekrom. If not,
focus on removing the barriers else
you will get overwhelmed when the
next wave of metal arrives.

Hard to consistently beat itemless 
unless your abilities trigger well.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 7 moves left

At least Moves +5 for this one, maybe
add Disruption Delay on top of that if you
never get consistently 2 moves left
when training itemless.

It is very reliant on Sleep Charm & Block
Smash+. Itemless I can either deal only
half the HP or finish with 4 moves left,
that's how unpredictable it can be.

name: Magmar
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 4 Metal and 2 Magmar
Timer: Adds 4 Metal and 2 Magmar every 2 moves
recommendedParty:
[Blastoise]/[Swampert]/
[Garchomp]/[Aerodactyl]

Excadrill, Milotic,
Stunfisk, Seismitoad,
Tyranitar

Terrakion, Greninja,
Gliscor, Suicune

Palkia, Groudon,
Kyogre, Gigalith,
Ash-Greninja
clearingStrategy:
Disruptions are tough. You'll quickly 
be overwhelmed, even when bringing
both Golurk and Gigalith.

Disruption Delay is advised to beat
this stage, else it's really painful
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

DD and Moves +5 will get the job done.
Don't pick M-Aero if you go for DD.

Gengar/Ray with Power of 4+ pokémon
(Terrakion, Ash-Greninja) can S rank with
only Disruption Delay.

name: Mega Scizor
disruptions:
Board: None
Initial: Adds 4 Metal
Timer: Adds 4 Metal every 2 moves

HP<= 51%: Fill column 1 or 5 or row 1 or 5 with Metal every 2 moves

Added: Scizor.
recommendedParty:
[Charizard Y]/[Blaziken]/
[Aerodactyl]

Salamence, Braviary,
Ninetales, Tyranitar

Delphox, Moltres,
Heatran, Terrakion

Ho-Oh, Lugia, Gigalith,
Talonflame, Emboar
clearingStrategy:
I do not think that Mega Start and
Moves +5 with M-Aerodactyl are 
enough to beat this stage consistently.

That leaves us with using Disruption
Delay on top of that to avoid the C-1,
so with that M-Aero is out of the way.

Full Pyre team should do ok, with the
Scizor icons falling and matching
themselves. Please note I have not
tried this, as I will go for the immediate
S rank to never play this stage ever
again. Feel free to contact me with
your successful teams and strats,
I will add them with pleasure.
srankingStrategy:
Moves: At least 10 moves left

You need that C-1 for the S rank. What you
play it with may vary.

C-1, Mega Start, Moves +5 with M-Aero.
That works apprently well from the 
feedback I gathered. You can go M-Aero
with Skyblast team, or Pyre. Both should
be fine.

Else, there is the bit more expensive option
with full items, using M-Ray and either
Skyblast or Pyre team. It's 1500 coins more
than the previous option, but I think it is
safer thanks to the better combo potential.

Full item run with Rayquaza, Reshiram,
Ho-Oh and Delphox is super safe. 4 moves
over the S rank, and I did not even have
great combos.
notes:
Congratulations! You get the stone
for Scizor!
ability: Mega Effects: Erases a jagged line of Pokémon horizontally.
